Sentencas: The electrolyte slurry was prepared by mixing Gd-doped CeO2 (GDC), solvent (ethanol and toluene), a polymer (polyvinyl butyral (PVB)) binder, and a dispersant (an amine system).
Titulo: Effects of Polymer Binder in Electrolyte Slurries and Their Microtubular SOFC Applications

Sentencas: The slurries were processed by an atomization process and coated on the top of microtubular tubes.
Titulo: Effects of Polymer Binder in Electrolyte Slurries and Their Microtubular SOFC Applications

Sentencas: A very smooth (with no cracks) electrolyte surface was obtained when the PVB polymer content was 8 wt.
Titulo: Effects of Polymer Binder in Electrolyte Slurries and Their Microtubular SOFC Applications

Sentencas: % (regular solution); however, a unique natural patchwork-type nanoporous grain boundary was obtained when the polymer content was increased to 16 wt.
Titulo: Effects of Polymer Binder in Electrolyte Slurries and Their Microtubular SOFC Applications
Effects of Polymer Binder in Electrolyte Slurries and Their Microtubular SOFC Applications

Sentencas: The results of this study show that polymers (binders) can be used not only to fabricate a dense electrolyte but also to generate a nanoporous grain boundary.
Titulo: Effects of Polymer Binder in Electrolyte Slurries and Their Microtubular SOFC Applications

Sentencas: The fabricated electrolytes have been tested for solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) applications in the intermediate-temperature region.
Titulo: Effects of Polymer Binder in Electrolyte Slurries and Their Microtubular SOFC Applications

Sentencas: The microtubular cell with dense electrolytes maintained a high performance even under 600 degrees C.
Titulo: Effects of Polymer Binder in Electrolyte Slurries and Their Microtubular SOFC Applications
